meanings.definition: Dullness or lack of brightness in appearance
meanings.sent1: The room's drabness was evident in its faded curtains and worn-out furniture.
meanings.sent2: The artist used vibrant colors to combat the drabness of the painting.
meanings.sent3: Despite the drabness of the situation, she managed to find humor in the mundane.
meanings.sent4: The drabness of the city streets mirrored his somber mood.
meanings.sent5: The drabness of the desert landscape made it seem endless and desolate.

meanings.definition: A state of being uninteresting or monotonous
meanings.sent1: The drabness of the lecture made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: She tried to add some excitement to the party to break the drabness.
meanings.sent3: The drabness of his jokes was so bad that they became funny.
meanings.sent4: The drabness of the routine was like a never-ending cycle of boredom.
meanings.sent5: The drabness of the book's plot made it difficult to finish reading.
